website_summaries.verdict: Not everyone needs a large power tool kit. That's why this dual-tool set is a practical choice, even though it comes with a few flaws.
pros: An inexpensive kit that includes a drill and driver and circular saw, important tools that satisfy the needs of most homeowners and do-it-yourselfers
Drill includes LED light and delivers 310 pounds of torque, suitable for minor to mid-level tasks
cons: Safety on the saw is known to break

customer_reviews.title: Saw motor burned up on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I needed the impact driver and saw both fir a porch rebuild. (I had the same saq earlier) but my my brother used it making a 45 degree cut in a 2x12 and burned up rhe motor. The package deal sounded good fir the price but the new saw started smoking after 3 minutes of cutting through about 6 feet of 1x6 floor boards - nothing heavy duty at all. I havent really tried the driver yet. I was greatly disappointed as I own many black and decker tools and the others have performed well. I enjoy being able to share batteries between tools, but do not enjoy motors that burn up so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Home Renovation Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The battery isn't one for the books, I would suggest getting a secondary battery if you intend to use this product for extended periods of time. I have yet to use the Circular Saw, however the Max Drill/Driver has helped me in my bathroom renovation (mixing mortar and screwing down concrete backer board for tile). Although, in truth, the jobs have not been small by nature which could contribute to the battery life being less than exceptional, the lighter tasks around the house that required a drill went quickly. Very light weight and easily maneuvered. I wouldn't rush to purchase this again, but it served its purpose. Remember, back up battery!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Saw broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift. He loved it but was using the saw and it froze. He wasn't cutting a big thick piece of wood either, just a thin piece of plywood. I did contact customer service and they made it right and sent out another saw. So he was happy with the results. Can't complain when customer service actually did take care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Does It All For A Fraction of the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have owned DeWalt, Makita, and other brands of cordless drills/tools. This set will give any of them a run for their money, at a fraction of the cost. The drill has every feature I need, and the light can be activated by slightly pulling the trigger, without turning the drill on. The saw is compact, light weight, and will cut through a 2"x4" with ease. It also has marked guides on the blade cover so I can set the depth of the blade correctly. Well worth it to me, and under $100 for the set, and a nice zippered bag, and charger.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good units and light weight but loaded with power.
customer_reviews.text: Very good purchase. I also purchased a spare battery. (A must). Used the tools to build a dumb bell weight rack (2x4's) and never ran out of juice with swapping out the batteries. Whole lot of torque in driver - had to dial it down when screwing in fasteners. Circular Saw cuts very well -- made 6 - 8 cuts before needed to swap batteries. My next purchase along these lines will be the Black & Decker LB2X4020-OPE 4.0 Ah Lithium Battery Pack, 20-volt - twice the power and long life.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I needed the cordless saw and was happy to have a back-up drill as well
customer_reviews.text: I am not a contractor. I don't work with my tools 50-60 hours per week. However, I do a lot of handyman work, and do use my tools often. I needed the cordless saw and was happy to have a back-up drill as well. I bought from Amazon's "Used" stock, and it has been perfect. Still working. I could have paid more for new or for a higher rated name brand, but for my purposes, this has been perfect and it has worked flawlessly. The saw does not seem as powerful as others I have used, but again, for the few times I need to slice through a roof board or other small task, it works.

This drill/driver has an LED work light to help illuminate projects in tight or dark spaces, along with an 11 position clutch. This units is lightweight for easier use and mobility. The Black & Decker circular saw features a high torque motor, using a 5-1/2 inch blade. It has a tool-free depth of cut and bevel adjustment for easy use, and the compact design also helps add to ease of use in small or tight spaces. Both of these tools are run by a Lithium Ion battery, which is always ready for use and holds a charge up to 18 months.
